008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.pub.lucaskanade;
010
011import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
012import imagingbook.lib.ij.IjUtils;
013import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
016
017/**
018 * Lucas-Kanade (forward-additive) matcher, as described in Simon Baker and Iain Matthews, 
019 * "Lucas-Kanade 20 Years On: A Unifying Framework: Part 1", CMU-RI-TR-02-16 (2002)
020 * Also called the "forward-additive" algorithm.
021 * This version assumes that the the origin of R is at its center!
022 *  @author Wilhelm Burger
023 *  @version 2014/02/08
024 */
025public class LucasKanadeForwardMatcher extends LucasKanadeMatcher {
026        
027        private int n;                                                          // number of warp parameters
028        private FloatProcessor Ix, Iy;                          // gradient of the search image
029        private double qmag = Double.MAX_VALUE;         // magnitude of parameter difference vector
030        private double sqrError = Double.MAX_VALUE;     // squared sum of differences between I and R
031        private double[][][] S;                                         // S[u][u][n] = the steepest descent image for dimension n at pos. u,v (same size as R)
032
033        /**
034         * Creates a new matcher of type {@link LucasKanadeForwardMatcher}.
035         * @param I the search image (of type {@link FloatProcessor}).
036         * @param R the reference image (of type {@link FloatProcessor})
037         * @param params a parameter object of type  {@link LucasKanadeMatcher.Parameters}.
038         */
039        public LucasKanadeForwardMatcher(FloatProcessor I, FloatProcessor R, Parameters params) {
040                super(I, R, params);
041        }
042        
043        public LucasKanadeForwardMatcher(FloatProcessor I, FloatProcessor R) {
044                super(I, R, new Parameters());
045        }
046
047        @Override
048        public boolean hasConverged() {
049                return (qmag < params.tolerance);
050        }
051
052        @Override
053        public double getRmsError() {
054                return Math.sqrt(sqrError);
055        }
056
057        private void initializeMatch(ProjectiveMapping2D Tinit) {
058//              n = Tinit.getParameters().length;
059                n = getParameters(Tinit).length;
060                Ix = gradientX(I);
061                Iy = gradientY(I);
062                iteration = 0;
063        }
064
065        @Override
066        public ProjectiveMapping2D iterateOnce(ProjectiveMapping2D Tp) {
067                if (iteration < 0) {
068                        initializeMatch(Tp);
069                }
070                iteration = iteration + 1;
071                double[][] H = new double[n][n];        // n x n cumulated Hessian matrix
072                double[] dp = new double[n];            // n-dim vector \delta_p = 0
073                sqrError = 0;
074
075                if (params.showSteepestDescentImages) {
076                        S = new double[wR][hR][];               // S[u][v] holds a double vector of length n
077                }
078                
079                // for all positions (u,v) in R do
080                for (int u = 0; u < wR; u++) {
081                        for (int v = 0; v < hR; v++) {
082                                //double[] x = {u - xc, v - yc};        // position w.r.t. the center of R
083                                Point x = Point.create(u - xc, v - yc);         // position w.r.t. the center of R
084                                //double[] xT = Tp.applyTo(x);          // warp x -> x'
085                                Point xT = Tp.applyTo(x);               // warp x -> x'
086
087//                              double gx = Ix.getInterpolatedValue(xT[0], xT[1]);      // interpolate the gradient at pos. xw
088//                              double gy = Iy.getInterpolatedValue(xT[0], xT[1]);
089                                double gx = Ix.getInterpolatedValue(xT.getX(), xT.getY());      // interpolate the gradient at pos. xw
090                                double gy = Iy.getInterpolatedValue(xT.getX(), xT.getY());
091                                
092                                double[] G = new double[] {gx, gy};                             // interpolated gradient vector
093
094                                // Step 4: Evaluate the Jacobian of the warp W at position x
095                                double[][] J = Tp.getJacobian(x);
096
097                                // Step 5: compute the steepest descent image:
098                                double[] sx = Matrix.multiply(G, J); // I_steepest = gradI(xy) * dW/dp(xy)  is a n-dim vector
099
100                                if (params.showSteepestDescentImages && iteration == 1) {
101                                        S[u][v] = sx;
102                                }
103
104                                // Step 6: Update the Hessian matrix
105                                double[][] Hx = Matrix.outerProduct(sx, sx);
106                                H = Matrix.add(H, Hx);
107
108                                // Step 7: Compute sum_x [gradI*dW/dp]^T (R(x)-I(W(x;p))] = Isteepest^T * Exy]
109                                double d = R.getf(u, v) - I.getInterpolatedValue(xT.getX(), xT.getY());
110                                sqrError = sqrError + d * d;
111
112                                dp = Matrix.add(dp, Matrix.multiply(d, sx));
113                        }
114                }
115
116                if (params.showHessians && iteration == 1) {
117                        IjUtils.createImage("H", H).show();
118                        IjUtils.createImage("Hi", Matrix.inverse(H)).show();
119                }
120
121                // Step 8: Compute delta_p using Equation 10
122                //                      double[][] Hi = Matrix.invert(H);
123                //                      if (Hi == null) {
124                //                              IJ.log("could not invert Hessian matrix!");
125                //                              return null;
126                //                      }
127                // Step 9: update the parameter vector
128                //                      double[] dp = Matrix.multiply(Hi, S);
129
130                // Step 8/9 (alternative)
131                double[] qopt = Matrix.solve(H, dp);
132                if (qopt == null) {     // this should not happen
133                        throw new RuntimeException(this.getClass().getName() + ": Encountered singular Hessian matrix!");
134                        //return null;
135                }
136                
137//              double[] p = Matrix.add(Tp.getParameters(), qopt);
138                double[] p = Matrix.add(getParameters(Tp), qopt);
139                qmag = Matrix.normL2squared(qopt);
140
141                if (params.showSteepestDescentImages && iteration == 1) {
142                        showSteepestDescentImages(S);
143                }
144
145//              return ProjectiveMapping2D.fromParameters(p);
146                return toProjectiveMap(p);
147        }
148}
